best.why: It extends the manifesto's existing motifs (flood, judgment, cost-shift) without re-stating them verbatim, keeps the aphoristic cadence, and adds sharp definitional stakes (slop as a condition, not a medium) that naturally follows "signs the cut."

worst.why: It largely repeats what the manifesto has already said in section I (including the Gutenberg/photography/A.I. escalation), so as a continuation it feels like looping instead of advancing.

must_survive_line: Slop is not a medium. Slop is a condition: publication without judgment.
